Package io.sourceforge.curtthomas.isbn

Class JsonIsbn

java.lang.Object
io.sourceforge.curtthomas.isbn.JsonIsbn
public class JsonIsbn
extends Object
Writes one or more JSON strings containing an International Standard Book Numbers components to standard output when invoked.

The main() method is invoked from the command line as follows:


                        java io.sourceforge.curtthomas.JsonIsbn 3458329021 9780863698774
Or:

                        java io.sourceforge.curtthomas.JsonIsbn true 3458329021 9780863698774
If the String literal "true" is passed instead of an ISBN as the first argument to the JsonIsbn command, the output will include a newline character following each key/value pair. The default behavior is to include the newline character only after each JSON string's closing brace.

If the JsonIsbn command is not followed by at least one ISBN number, the main() method will send a message to standard output rather than continue running.

ISBNs passed as parameters are discarded if their respective prefixes cannot be inferred based on RangeMessage.xml.

ISBNs in 13-digit format that do not begin with either 978 or 979, and ISBNs in 10-digit format that do not contain ten digits once that characters that are not digits or the roman numeral X (or x) are removed, are discarded.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String... argv)
      Calls the Isbn class's allComponentsAsJson() method and writes the results to standard output.
      Parameters:
      argv - One or more International Standard Book Numbers in either 13-digit or 10-digit format, delimited on the command line by a space character or, from code, by a comma. If the String literal "true" is used as the first parameter, the output will contain a newline character after each key/value pair; otherwise, the only newline character to occur will be at the very end of the JSON string, following its closing brace.
      • If an ISBN's prefix cannot be determined based on RangeMessage.xml, the ISBN is discarded. A message is written to the standard error stream and the main() method continues to run.
      • ISBNs in 13-digit format are discarded if they do not begin with either 978 or 979, as are ISBNs in 10-digit format that do not comprise exactly ten characters once that those that are not digits or the roman numeral 10 (x,X) are removed.
      • The JsonIsbn class is intended for use with existing ISBNs. Passing ISBNs as parameters that have never been assigned to an item as a consequence of a decision by a publisher or an agency could cause main(), allComponentsAddedKeys(), allComponentsMinKeys(), allComponentsAsJson(), or the Isbn class's main() method to throw a runtime exception.
      See Also:
      Isbn.allComponentsAsJson(String... isbns), Isbn.main(String... argv)
